  • Constructor Details

    • InputType

      InputType(String inputName, String inputDescription, String inputMatch, String inputItems, CcddConstants.InputTypeFormat inputFormat, boolean isInputCustom)
      Input type class constructor
      Parameters:
      inputName - Input type name
      inputDescription - Input type description
      inputMatch - Regular expression match for the input type
      inputItems - String containing the acceptable values for this input type, separated by the selection item list separator; null or blank if the input type doesn't constrain the inputs to items from a list. The list is used to create the contents of the combo box in the table column with this input type
      inputFormat - Input type format
      isInputCustom - True if the input type is user-defined

      protected String getInputMatch()
      Get the input type matching regular expression
      Returns:
      Input type matching regular expression

    • getInputItems

      protected List<String> getInputItems()
      Get the input type selection items
      Returns:
      List of input type selection items; null if the input type has no selection items

    • setInputItems

      protected void setInputItems(List<String> inputItems)
      Set the input type selection items
      Parameters:
      inputItems - List of input type selection items (an empty item is automatically prepended to the list to allow blanking the selection); null if the input type has no selection items

    • getInputFormat

      protected CcddConstants.InputTypeFormat getInputFormat()
      Get the input type format
      Returns:
      Input type format

    • isCustomInput

      protected boolean isCustomInput()
      Check if the input type is user-defined
      Returns:
      True if the input type is defined by the user

    • getInputFormatByName

      protected static CcddConstants.InputTypeFormat getInputFormatByName(String formatName)
      Get the input type format associated with the supplied input format name
      Parameters:
      formatName - Input format name
      Returns:
      Input type format associated with the supplied input format name; 'Text' format if the name supplied is invalid

    • formatInput

      protected String formatInput(String valueS)
      Reformat the input value for numeric types. This adds a leading zero to floating point values if the first character is a decimal, and removes '+' signs and unneeded leading zeroes from integer and floating point values. Leading zeroes are preserved for hexadecimal values
      Parameters:
      valueS - Value, represented as a string, to reformat
      Returns:
      Input value reformatted based on its input type

    • formatInput

      protected String formatInput(String valueS, boolean preserveZeroes)
      Reformat the input value for numeric types. This adds a leading zero to floating point values if the first character is a decimal, and removes '+' signs and unneeded leading zeroes from integer and floating point values
      Parameters:
      valueS - Value, represented as a string, to reformat
      preserveZeroes - True to preserve leading zeroes in hexadecimal values; false to eliminate the extra zeroes (this is useful when comparing the text representation of two hexadecimal values)
      Returns:
      Input value reformatted based on its input type

    • convertItemStringToList

      protected static List<String> convertItemStringToList(String inputItemsString)
      Convert the input selection items from a single string to a list
      Parameters:
      inputItemsString - String containing the acceptable values for this input type, separated by the selection item list separator (a blank item is automatically prepended to the list); null or blank if the input type doesn't constrain the inputs to items from a list
      Returns:
      Input items, converted to a list; null if the input type has no items

    • convertItemListToString

      protected static String convertItemListToString(List<String> inputItemsList)
      Convert the input selection items from a list to a single string
      Parameters:
      inputItemsList - List containing the acceptable values for this input type; null or blank if the input type doesn't constrain the inputs to items from a list
      Returns:
      Input items, converted to a string, separated by the selection item list separator; blank if the input type has no items
